intro: Norantea albidorosea, commonly known as the pale pink orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. The plant produces showy, fragrant blooms during the spring and summer months, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem, contributing to its elegant appearance. Norantea albidorosea thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
